page.title: 02Landscape - Kirkandrews
page.content: There is a Roman Wall under the footpath which runs from Kirkandrews-on-Eden to Beaumont. We often walk along this footpath as it runs between our school and the River Eden. Being on the Roman Wall it is high and on a clear day we can see from Criffel in the north west to Cross Fell in the south east. Down a steep bank, ninety eight metres away from the path and across a meadow, is the River Eden. Here it is a tidal river and is famous for salmon fishing. The view from the footpath is over pleasant open countryside with only the tops of high buildings and Carlisle Cathedral seen in the south east. There are a few trees on the lower land, the higher fells being barren. The fields are small and separated by hawthorn hedges.
